medical_history.chief_complaint: Bipolar disorder with varying mood episodes including severe depressive episodes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Diagnosed at age 23 after a manic episode post-college graduation, characterized by insomnia, agitation, racing thoughts, grandiosity, and fluctuating mood. Throughout the following years, the patient experienced stability with treatment but began to develop more severe depressive episodes and mild hypomanic episodes after 10 years. Recent symptoms included decreased sleep and suicidal ideation during depressive episodes lasting up to a month.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bipolar disorder diagnosed at 23, history of depressive symptoms in childhood and adolescence, including a small overdose of aspirin at age 16.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandfather was an alcoholic who committed suicide; maternal history of untreated depressive symptoms.
medical_history.social_history: Maintained steady employment in the hotel industry, established long-term friendships, remained single, and had close relations with her sister and nieces.
